online.review_text: Oh, Pizza Hut, the grand emporium of doughy circles and cheese-laden dreams! Let me regale you with a tale of culinary adventure at the Hut of Pizza.The Quest for the Cheesy GrailOnce upon a recent Tuesday, I embarked on a quest for the fabled Cheesy Grail, a mythical pizza said to contain the perfect ratio of cheese to crust. The journey was fraught with peril, as I navigated the treacherous terrains of the great menu and decided to order my flumongous choiceThe Arrival of the Saucy SteedLo and behold, a steed of steel (also known as a delivery scooter) arrived, bearing the treasure chest (pizza box, that is). With bated breath, I lifted the lid to gaze upon the golden bounty... only to find the Cheeseburger Pizza staring back. A fusion of fast food royalty and Italian zest, it was a sight to behold.The Feast of KingsAs I took my first bite, the heavens parted, and the angels sang—or perhaps it was just the sound of my own contented munching. The crust, a buttery bastion of flavor, held the toppings like a king cradles his crown jewels. The cheese stretched with each bite, creating strings of deliciousness that could've lassoed the moon.The AftermathIn the end, the pizza was vanquished, leaving behind only memories and a greasy box as a testament to the glorious battle. I sat back, a conqueror, my hunger sated, my taste buds jubilant, and my heart full—both metaphorically and quite literally.In conclusion, Pizza Hut, you've done it again. You've taken the humble ingredients of flour, cheese, and tomato sauce and turned them into a feast fit for jesters and kings alike. Bravo! 👏🍕

If you're craving a delightful pizza experience in the heart of the city, look no further than Pizza Hut at City Centre Mall. This hidden gem of cheesy goodness never fails to impress.From the moment you walk in, the aroma of freshly baked pizza teases your senses, and you know you're in for a treat. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, making it perfect for both family gatherings and casual outings with friends.Now, let's talk about the main attraction – the pizza! The menu offers a variety of options to suit every palate. Whether you're a classic Margherita lover or an adventurer seeking unique toppings, Pizza Hut has you covered. The thin-crust options are delightfully crispy, while the pan pizzas are the epitome of comfort food.As for the service, it's exceptional. The staff is attentive, prompt, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure your dining experience is top-notch. They make you feel like a valued guest.The drink options are varied, and the dessert menu is the perfect way to end your meal on a sweet note.The next time you're in the mood for pizza, don't hesitate to stop by this slice of heaven. You won't be disappointed.

We had our wedding reception here in Sept this year. I've had to think hard about what to write as I want to be fair.We chose the Missing sock as it is a bit alternative, it has a large outdoor space, on-site bedrooms and very fairly priced. We were happy with our initial interactions with the events organiser, but unfortunately the venue passed management/ownership multiple times. We went through 4 different event organisers. The communication was very poor, and there seemed to be little/No organisation. The day before the wedding the events organiser was out of the country and the person covering them knew nothing about our plan for the day.They tried to change us additional fees the day before the wedding, they had not kept a  record of the payments we had made to them. They charged us a £200 fee for booking an external pizza van, despite the fact they had failed to book one themselves (we had been told months earlier that this had been taken care of).When we arrived to start setting up we had to get the tables out of the muddy field. The tables were in poor condition and they did not have table cloths as promised. The chairs had been in storage and were dirty and mismatched. The patio in the marquee was filthy and littered with cigarette butts. There were initials of a previous couple painted on the decking.Despite the stress of the above issues, on the day the staff worked hard, the home made BBQ and sides were delicious, and we had a lovely time. The bedroom we stayed in was comfy and clean. Having the teepees for guests to sleep in is a big plus.Its such a shame as they have a great space and so much potential but their lack of organisation, communication and care needs serious work.

Had a great time, well looked after, a good roast. Very accommodating staff, engaging and relaxed, could have a laugh and enjoy a great meal. New management and really looking forward to seeing them continue to grow. Good luck and definitely will be back. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Yu Garden is a stunning oasis in the midst of Shanghai's bustling cityscape. The classical Chinese garden design, with its beautiful pavilions, ponds, rockeries, and bridges, provides a serene and picturesque setting. The intricate carvings and traditional architecture transport you back in time. Despite being a popular tourist spot and often crowded, the garden's layout offers plenty of quiet corners to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. The nearby bazaar is perfect for picking up souvenirs and sampling local snacks. Highly recommend visiting early in the morning to beat the crowds and fully appreciate the tranquility of this historical gem. Don't forget your camera – the scenery is absolutely beautiful!

Beautiful garden, but kind of a steep ticket price for a park/garden this size. Well worth seeing, still. Extremely photogenic. I wish we’d come earlier in the day, as it closes quite early and we’d have loved to stay longer (and get our money’s worth).Most of the temples and parks we’ve seen in China were vast and have a sense of size and scope. This one is very quiet and intimate (despite the crowds) and lovely in a different way. It has a feel I associate more with Japanese gardens.

Yes, this place is touristy.However, it has a fantastic ambiance that makes it worth the visit. It’s the perfect spot to indulge in try street food while soaking up the vibrant atmosphere. The surrounding architecture is a beautiful showcase of traditional Chinese design.

One of the most important historical landmarks in Shanghai, it contains Chinese-style houses and wonderful places for photography. It can be reached by subway line 10. Was pleased to have the opportunity to order online via QR code, there you can also pay for it and leave a tip. But the waiter's service leaves much to be desired. Maybe the waiter was feeling ill or something, but he made 2 mistakes in our small order, didn't bring soup and gave a different salad. But we still left him a good tip. Always leave a tip for the waiters and delivery guys.

We loved it, thank you to the team for this wonderful meal.

I was immediately greeted by such friendly staff who not only had my room ready 90 minutes before check in but also gave me a fantastic complimentary upgrade.The room was of a good standard and featured a wonderful balcony overlooking the Cambridge city skyline.I had dinner in my second night at the hotel and the lobster was gorgeous. Booked a night away for a birthday, as the location was very central to Cambridge.We paid the extra charge to have our car parked (car park is in a separate location to the hotel)  which was quite useful due to Cambridge being so busy.Prior to arrival we had made the hotel staff aware that it was a birthday trip and they offered to give a complementary cake and card in the room which was a nice touch.As we checked in we were told we’d been upgraded to the “King Room” for free which was nice, but when we actually saw our rooms we were a bit underwhelmed, the views weren’t great, one of the rooms facing the back of the building where the bins / ventilator area is and overall the rooms were very disappointing, stained and a bit dusty. It was pleasant enough for the one night however not worth the price we had paid… curtains were stained and shower was dirty at the edges - things we tried to ignore for the sake of the trip but certainly did not go unnoticed.We went up to the rooftop bar expecting to be in awe, as the pictures looked so good; although there were some nice views, the actual bar was again, underwhelming … no music, bar staff were rushing around us creating a bit of an unsettling atmosphere, drinks were ok but again there lacked attention to detail.The spa was basic, and separate from the actual hotel building. A small jacuzzi which had to be turned on by the staff for it to create any bubbles, a sauna and steam room, nothing groundbreaking.Overall an ok stay but nothing amazing, we were a bit disappointed.

The staff at d’arrays were very attentive and the service was really efficient. We had the Camembert to share which was delicious but the cheese the bread ratio was a bit off! We also had the half roast chicken which was a generous portion and really tasty!The liquor loft was lovely and quiet for a Friday night. Despite the unexpected tranquillity at 7.30 pm, our experience at the restaurant had its ups and downs. The quiet atmosphere, though surprising, persisted throughout the night, questioning the necessity of a reservation. Regrettably, even with few patrons, our table was often overlooked, requiring us to clear our plates and order drinks at the bar.A commendable male staff member checked on us, but he returned to his post upstairs.The toilets, located in the adjacent building, were confusingly placed and could benefit from a more appealing decor to match the interior charm.On a positive note, the captivating decor created a delightful setting for our book club and would suit other gatherings. The wine and food menu offered reasonable options for various budgets, but an expansion of vegan choices would be appreciated.The subdued ambience, conducive to easy conversation, somewhat dampened the overall restaurant atmosphere.Dog friendly

Michaelhouse Cafe has fast become my favourite place to stop for a coffee in Cambridge. It's in an old church! The architecture is wonderful. I really enjoy sitting upstairs and marvelling at the roof and the stained glass.The food is delicious. The coffees are consistently well made. The service is fast, efficient, friendly and welcoming.There are plenty of seats but it does get quite busy. Students tend to take the tables with a coffee and a laptop and work most of the day. There's a bit of outdoor seating as well but I haven't used that yet. Like I said I like to sit upstairs - the wooden spiral staircase is awesome - and just marvel at the architecture with my drink and treat of the week.Highly recommend visiting here. The prices are reasonable (£4.02 for a decent sized slice of Basque Burnt Cheesecake), the portion sizes are good, the staff are lovely, the venue is clean and tidy, and it's just a really nice place to sit and have a drink.Parking: There is no parking in the immediate area. The closest area to park is the Grand Arcade multistorey carpark.Kid-friendliness: The tables are quite close together and it does get fairly busy, but as long as your kids are sat at the tables with you and not running around you'll be ok.

The Copper Kettle in Cambridge is a delightful place for a relaxed meal with a perfect view of one of the city's famous colleges. Its large windows allow natural light to flood the interior, creating a bright and inviting atmosphere. The setting feels both casual and elegant, making it ideal for breakfast, a casual tea break, or a light Mediterranean-inspired meal.We visited for breakfast and tea before embarking on another walk around the beautiful city, and it was an excellent start to the day. The menu offers a nice variety of Mediterranean dishes, and everything we ordered was fresh, flavorful, and well-presented. The breakfast selection was particularly good, with options that cater to both traditional and more adventurous tastes. We enjoyed our tea as well, served in a relaxed manner that allowed us to linger and enjoy the lovely view of the college across the street.The service was friendly and attentive without being intrusive, which made the experience even more pleasant. The staff ensured we were comfortable and had everything we needed without any rush, making it easy to enjoy the moment. The cafe's location is perfect for anyone looking to take in the sights of Cambridge, as it is situated in a bustling area that is still peaceful enough for a quiet meal.Overall, The Copper Kettle is a wonderful spot for anyone visiting Cambridge, especially if you're looking for a charming, light-filled space to enjoy a leisurely meal. Highly recommended!

Lots of tourists here and in area. Lots of outdoor seating. Affordable for a tourist area. Would visit here again on a sunnier day for lunch outside if I knew I didn’t need to get away quickly.

The service was great. The person behind the counter helped explain the menu to me and gave me a detailed explanation of each item. This was probably the best part of my experience here. Friendly and helpful service can make or break a restaurant.The ambiance was unique and fun. The walls were painted with bright colors and the space between seating was more than adequate. There were well placed bar stools in front of the windows also.The food is where the wheels started to come off. I ordered a custom bowl with rice and bulgogi. Among my choices, I had regular kimchee, their version of oi-sobagi (cucumber kim chee), and some odeng (fish cake). Both Kim chee dishes had mild heat and acid with just enough flavor to make it passable as a kim chee. The odeng, although the right sponginess, didn't have much flavor to it at all. Those items I could deal with. The real issue for me was that both the bulgogi and rice were both very cold and almost flavorless. I'm unsure of the style of Korean inspired food but I'm accustomed to warm/hot meats and rice with cold sides that have spicy heat. I finished my food because it wasn't terrible; it was just bland.

Little Seoul is a Korean take on BYOB restaurants like Chipotle, Cava etc.It was my first time here, and the girl behind the counter was really sweet and helpful. I ended up getting the purple rice as my base and the bulgogi as my protein. You can choose 5 toppings; I went with the edamame, green onions, corn, radish, and cucumbers. Some of the ingredients didn't look the freshest, but that's a typical downside of BYOB places in lieu of convenience. (Everything still tasted good though). For sauces, I went with the employees recommendation of yum yum sauce and gochujang.Aside from the BYOB bar, they also have menu items to pick from. I decided to try the Budae Jjigae (Army Stew). I ordered it to go and was impressed by how neatly everything was packed. The noodles and cheese were put in a separate container from the soup to prevent them from getting over cooked and soggy. The aroma from both items I ordered smelled so good and tempting as I was driving home. It was delicious and comforting!

The cream of crab soup I got was tasty but had no pieces of crab in it and was very thin. My garlic spinach was unremarkable and too salty. My friend got a sampler plate with cheese and the cheese seemed like it was just standard grocery store cheese.The servers seemed to be mostly checked out and were pretty forgetful. They mostly seemed to want to stand in the back and chitchat. Our server first forgot to bring us our check, and then forgot to bring us change.

Lunch Time Meal Saturday 30 December 2023My sister had invited a friend to the restaurant, to eat with us and as it was her friend's first visit to Cambridge, my sister explained to her friend that both of us eat there regularly, and have done so for a long time, so as we all arrived, we went in and were seated.We all ordered as a starter three dishes of spicy squid, which was stir fried, in light tempura batter with fresh garlic, chilli, and spring onion, and three large prawn crackers.Our Mains were three dishes of Yippee Noodles, with thick noodles, fried with prawns, roast pork, chicken, onion, and bean shoots topped with Yippee sauce.Our desserts were Banana Fritters in sesame seeds, with vanilla ice cream and syrup.We all enjoyed our meals very much. particularly my sister's friend, so much so that she said that the next time that she comes to Cambridge, she will bring her husband.Vegetarian options: The are on the menu.Kid-friendliness: The restaurant is kid friendly

The food here is really good. We were seated immediately as soon as we arrived but we were early for lunch as well. It seemed as though people started coming in at around one for lunch.The space is on the smaller side with about 10 or 12 tables but they do have an outdoor seating area as well. I came in November and it was too cold for us to sit outside. We were given a two person seat pretty quickly and they have one large table for parties of 6 to 8 people.We ordered the fondue with truffle oil, the burger and the octopus which was grilled. The burger was simply incredible I know that’s the last thing that you should order but it was actually really good. So if you decide to make a part of your order you won’t be disappointed. We did like the cheese fondue a lot but it is very filling and impossible to finish. Tasted great though. The octopus was not that delicious and I will probably skip it the next time. It does come with navy beans and loses a bit of the charred grilledness.The wait stuff was really good, they made good recommendations and were the ones who recommended the cheese fondue to us. I will definitely come back here if I am in the area for a quick lunch.

The Cow offers a delightful escape into Italian cuisine, blending exceptional food with a warm, inviting atmosphere. From the moment you step in, the cozy ambiance, complete with soft lighting and rustic decor, sets the stage for a memorable dining experience. The menu is a celebration of Italian classics, each dish crafted with care and attention to detail. The pasta, made fresh daily, is a standout—perfectly cooked and paired with rich, flavorful sauces that highlight the quality of the ingredients. The pizza is equally impressive, with a crispy crust and toppings that burst with freshness.For those who delve deeper into the menu, the seafood options are a must-try, showcasing a perfect balance of flavors. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, adding to the overall comfort of the dining experience. Whether you're seeking a casual meal or a special night out, The Cow delivers on all fronts, making it a top choice for Italian food lovers.

Couple sharing the regular size “Funghi” spaghetti and a large “Her Majesty’s Pleasure” pizza.  Spaghetti is not freshly or home made (no surprise) but the mushroom/cheese/cream sauce was pretty good but nothing special/memorable.  The quality and quantity of ingredients on top of the pizza tasted very good and looked very appealing — nice tomatoes, mushroom, onion, ham, pepperoni all good.  Weird: celery was added as a topping… consuming at least 1000 pizzas in my life across many countries, never seen that before.  I’ve nothing against celery, but it’s not a pizza topping!  No harm though.  Now, crust is a personal thing, to me this one was just a “slice of white bread”  (see photo) with no taste or structure.  Limp bread.  Still, overall the thing tasted pretty good.  Kudos to the staff who worked very hard and stayed pleasant, they were short staffed but kept things running well.  The cute stone cabin with live fireplace is so nice and quaint, love it, BUT what is the allowable occupancy of this place?  After awhile, customers  were tripping all over each other (literally, people unavoidably stepping on toes and elbowing people) so while cozy, it was actually pushing unsafe as there is no control person at the door and people just kept coming in unchecked into a very small place with only one door in use.  Maybe fix this, especially with a fireplace at the center of the throng, these are the types of things that are “all good and merry” until something happens.  Overall, an interesting place with nice staff and pretty good food where the pizza will appeal to some and will not be true pizza to others.Wheelchair accessibility: With wall to wall people allowed inside to wait on little stools between tables, it may be difficult to use a wheelchair inside.

This place totally lives up to its hype! Glad I followed the recommendations online and dined here. The food was super delicious and in large portions. It has a bedouin tent decor; and water and meals are served in traditional pottery, which makes up a cool ambiance. I had lamb liver for starters, lamb kofte for main meal, and the sunset djanet cocktail. Service was also great, I was waited by Yasin and Amanda who were both amazing. I understand prices are normal for Cambridge but totally a bargain compared to London given the quality!! Starters and cocktails around £7 and all mains around £15-£20. Also, they keep a halal kitchen and all coctails are non-alcoholic, which helps if you have Muslim dietary restrictions. (I could finally eat meat outside, hooray.) Overall, this place made my day, totally recommended. Definitely MAKE A RESERVATION in advance, I showed up without one and although it was Monday night they were fully booked. Luckily I was there early and they could accommodate me. As I was leaving, the place was full!

Best wedding venue there is! I attended a wedding here and knew it was my dream venue so when I got engaged, it was the top of the list! Having an air conditioned chapel & reception area was important to me (especially for a July Texas wedding) that still allowed for lots of natural light and this was PERFECT! The chapel feels intimate and special for the ceremony and the reception is huge to allow for a fun party! Hunter and Christine answered all our questions so promptly along the way and we couldn’t be more grateful for their help!(Photo credits: Christa Robey Photography)

The Gardenia Venue is an absolute stunner! We toured several wedding venues in the DFW area but nothing compares to the beautiful windows in the chapel, the white canvas to create your own vision with, and the stunning building as you pull up with the fountain. Most of all the owners were what made us choose The Gardenia. I had put in an inquiry at 10pm for a tour and it must have been 30 min later that I received a response approving my tour. The timely and professional communication did not stop there. They were the first tour that greeted us with champagne and really made the place feel special. Whenever I had a question they were always quick to respond. We could not have asked for a better place to celebrate our special day! I’ll forever enjoy seeing it captured it all of the beautiful photos and be able to remember each moment. Thank you Hunter & Christine!

Hi! I'm a wedding photographer who recently shot a wedding at The Gardenia Venue in March. It was a super stormy day, but luckily The Gardenia Venue had all the indoor accommodations! It is a stunning venue with so many gorgeous photo options. Plus their landscaping was beautiful. Due to the rain we shot majority of their photos inside, which wasn't a problem because all of the natural light that The Gardenia Venue has. Gorgeous venue and such a sweet staff. I highly recommend them!

This was truly a breathtaking venue! It was the perfect backdrop to our wedding day. The bridal and groomsmen suites were spacious and stunning. There was so much space both in and outside for our 208 person wedding. Hunter and Christine were quick to respond to questions and very helpful in the process. I cannot recommend this venue enough!

The Gardenia Venue is the perfect foundation to create any wedding you can imagine. My husband and I got married here April 13, 2024, and it was an absolute dream come true. The venue itself is absolutely gorgeous, and the owners have created an environment where you can design exactly what you’re looking for. I can’t tell you how many compliments I received regarding the venue, and now all of my little cousins swear they will be getting married there too. It was such a beautiful experience, and the staff there are absolutely amazing. Every question was answered quickly when I had random thoughts leading up to the wedding, they offered their assistance with anything and everything on the day of the wedding, and everyone was extremely friendly. I am so grateful for the opportunity to be married at such a beautiful location!
This venue was everything and more for our wedding day! The venue doesn’t need much additional decor because it already is so stunning by itself! I would choose it over again!!

The Gardenia Venue is one of my all-time favorite wedding venues to photograph at! My brides ALWAYS rave about their photos!!! Not only is The Gardenia beautiful in every way, their staff is incredibly kind, attentive, and helpful. There are so many photo ops around the venue for creating and capturing the most beautiful pictures! Some features I love about the venue - clean slate for ANY wedding aesthetic, spacious bridal/groom suites, gorgeous white chapel, tons of photo op locations, a beautiful pond in the back (which makes for an amazing backdrop for sunset photos!), unique and romantic vibes! It truly is a stunner of a venue. The Gardenia is the perfect backdrop for your wedding day!!
Our wedding was absolutely everything we could have dreamed of! The Gardenia Venue was so help and so beautiful we didn’t feel like we needed to add much decor. The staff and owners are so helpful!

There are quite a few monuments scattered around the Dupont Circle neighbourhood including the Mahatma Gandhi Memorial situated in the small green space found at the intersection of Q. St. NW, Massachusetts NW. and 21st Street., just in front of the India Embassy.This is a life sized bronze of Gandhi, who is consider the Father of the nation (India) and spiritual leader who played a major role in India's pursuit of independence from the British Empire.Here you see elderly Gandhi, dressed in sandals and covered in basic cloth, a common image of Gandhi from his later years of life. His walking with the aid of a walking stick and looks fatigued. If you get close, you can see the age in his hands and upper body. Gandhi is standing on a granite base with engraving and information about the statue.If you are in Dupont Circle and browsing the neighbourhood, this is a neat statue to find. It is very near to the Philips Collection and the Anderson House and can be conveniently seen before or after these attractions.

Very small and great looking park. The Gandhi statue is very detailed and very impressive. It stands low enough were you can really get a good look at it and is subject to some great photos. The park also has a lot of literature engraved on it which is a very nice detail that will definitely keep you informed. I wish all parks were like this.

This is a great memorial. It has a couple benches so you can take a break and enjoy the sculpture.The details on the statue are great it is really one of the best done statues in the city. But trust me if you are walking embassy row use these benches to take a rest and plan the rest of your walk you won't see many more.
A statue of Gandhi just outside the Indian embassy
The Mahatma Gandi Statue is simply amazing.The bronze textured detail is induring in every respect.You can see Gandhi's vision and be inspiried to create your own vision for change.
The Gandhi Statue is a tiny park in NW DC in Dupont Circle close to The Phillips Collection. There are two benches you can reflect on. Other than that, that's it!
Fine statue as a tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and is located in a square right opposite the Indian embassy..
Very Inspiring Memorial. Looks just like the man. Embassy for India in  across the street. Recommend a visit for sure!
Alongside the road in the constant hustle of the city this statue is a nice visual reminder of what matters most.

Been here a couple times. Nice huge fish. More special than other dishes and feels healthier. The broth is sour-spicy and quite refreshing. There’s also some cabbage and veggie. Wish I had chopsticks tho. The stir fry tofu tastes good but on the salty side as are the curries here.— 202405Still thinking 4.5 for a bowl of rice is ridiculous. Red Curry is less salty this time fortunately. Beef is tender, with slices of butternut squash (personally I prefer chunky ones but it’s alright). Tofu looks nice too.The ice tea is also the slimmest I’ve seen.—-Panang Duck Curry is the most frequent main I order. I love the tender marinated skin-on duck breast pieces. The duck meat portion is generous, even more than the veggies. (Having been to places where potato and other fillers occupy the bowl I think this is decent.) The curry is rich but not too heavy. The only downside is I can literally taste salt…And a bowl of rice for 4.5 is unimaginable/unacceptable for an Asian restaurant.😹 Sometimes I just order mango rice dessert instead (sadly they refuse to substitute the ice cream flavor).Papaya carrot salad is really spicy, in a good way.Soup noodle and fried rice also look nice.Fish cake is less interesting and can be quite greasy.Depending on the hour the place can be cozy or snuggling or crowded. Service is friendly and prompt. Not my favorite in Cambridge, but duck curry isn’t so common here. Next time I’ll see if they will heed my less salt request..

Located just behind Stein's Cafe and part of their outdoor bar area. Steins has plans to expand their menu which currently has seafood items, including crab cakes.The museum is a series of amazing murals created as an homage to the history of DC's graffiti scene. The centerpiece is a memorial to Cool Disco Dan with a piece honoring Lisa of the World as well.The wall behind the bar is surrounded by a gate. You can enter inside the gate during open hours and view from outside the gate during closed hours.
A must see in DC! If you’re lucky, you might even meet one of the artists behind DC’s most iconic street murals, including those from the 2020 #muralsdc51 statehood blitz.

There are some beautiful works of art here with vibrant colors. The space is all open air, so it's a good COVID-friendly option. The venue is open for events such as weddings. You can see most of it from Crittenden and the alley off of there. At most you'll spend an hour here , and there isn't much else around, so plan on driving and/or biking there.

14th Street Graffiti Museum is an open-air museum along 14th Street and Crittenden Street NW. It opened on October 3, 2020.The museum is open daily from 11am to 8pm and admission is free.Walk inside and see a number of murals in honor of D.C.'s thriving street art scene and artists past and present. As you exit, don't forget to view the art outside of the building too.If you're looking for a unique, free experience in D.C., don't miss this museum.

The Royal Standard of England pub is one of the oldest pubs in the country, and it never fails to impress. I’ve visited a few times and had great experiences in different seasons. On a bright sunny day, I enjoyed sitting outside and soaking up the sunshine, making the most of the pub’s lovely outdoor area. During a chilly winter night, the cozy interior was the perfect retreat, offering warmth and comfort with its inviting atmosphere. The interior reflects its storied past with period features. The Royal Standard of England consistently delivers a memorable experience with its rich history and charm.

Nestled in the heart of the UK lies the Royal Standing Pub, a historical marvel and the oldest pub in the country. Stepping foot into this establishment is like stepping back in time, with its charming atmosphere and rich heritage that captivates visitors from near and far.During my recent visit to the Royal Standing Pub for a somber occasion—a funeral—I was pleasantly surprised by the warmth and hospitality that enveloped me upon arrival. The owner, a fascinating individual with a wealth of stories to share, added a personal touch to my experience and made me feel welcome in his establishment.Despite the melancholic reason for my visit, the Royal Standing Pub provided a comforting refuge with its cozy interior and inviting ambiance. The dimly lit space exuded a sense of history, with antique furnishings and quaint decor that spoke volumes about its long and storied past.One aspect of the Royal Standing Pub that truly stood out was the delightful cuisine it offered. The menu boasted a variety of traditional British dishes, each prepared with care and attention to detail. From hearty pies to classic roasts, every bite was a testament to the pub's commitment to quality and flavor.In the midst of sorrow, the delicious food served at the Royal Standing Pub provided a much-needed respite, offering a moment of solace and comfort during a difficult time. The combination of good company, delectable food, and a unique ambiance made my visit to the pub a memorable one that I will not soon forget.In conclusion, the Royal Standing Pub is a timeless gem that exudes character, charm, and a sense of history unlike any other. Whether you visit for a joyous occasion or a more solemn affair, this venerable establishment is sure to leave a lasting impression on all who pass through its doors. I highly recommend a visit to the Royal Standing Pub for a taste of history, hospitality, and culinary delights that are second to none.

Hong Kong Fusion, located near the Cambridge University area, is a vibrant restaurant that offers a blend of traditional Chinese cuisine with modern twists.We were a group of four who tried their fusion menu for dinner. The menu was extensive, featuring a variety of dishes that cater to different tastes, including classic dim sum, crab fry, flavorful stir-fries, noodles, and innovative fusion creations. Unfortunately, the quality of the food was not high; most of the dishes were overly salty and lacked balance. We were quite disappointed with our meals.The ambiance is stylish and contemporary, providing a pleasant setting for both casual meals and formal gatherings. One of the lady staff members who took our order was kind and helpful, but the rest of the staff were not particularly respectful to guests. Additionally, the high service charge was unacceptable.Overall, while the atmosphere and some of the staff were commendable, the food quality and service issues left much to be desired.

An evening walk through downtown Cambridge ended with a delicious dinner at Honk Kong Fusion restaurant. The restaurant is located near the Round Church and offers over 250 dishes on the menu, representing the cuisine from Hong Kong and China.I started with a bowl of Winter Melon & Pork Rib Soup which was a perfect beginning of the meal.Then, we ordered fried Pork Filling Dumplings which were delicious and very aromatic.I drank jasmine tea with my meal, which was a perfect addition to the food. My waiter was very friendly and also helped me with choosing the dishes.Finally, my warm food was very tasty. I definitely recommend Honk Kong Fusion restaurant to anyone who is looking for authentic Hong Kong and Chinese cuisine in a pleasant atmosphere.

What a surprise for Vegetarians!!Every other Thursday they offer a vegan buffet. My partner and I decided to have lunch here at Sitar yesterday, mainly because we happened to be in the area and that we read that the meats they serve (chicken, beef, lamb mainly) might be halal certified. We were served by Nabi, who was very helpful and lovely to us. I confirmed with him that everything (all foods) on the buffet menu is halal, and also noticed a physical copy of the halal certification at the buffet station.I come from Singapore, where I have had my fair share of consuming Indian cuisine (either Indian-Muslim food or authentic vegetarian Indian buffets that my Indian friends recommend), and I would say some dishes like palak paneer and dal bhaji are comparable to those served back at my home. The flavors are not as intense and still really enjoyable, while the meats they serve are tender as well. I'm a huge chicken fan and because of my dietary restriction, it's difficult to find chicken dishes to enjoy around here so I might be biased but I strongly recommend the Tandoori chicken and Curry chicken!Service-wise, Nabi did an excellent job in making sure we had a great dining experience and was so kind to us. Just as we were about to leave, he provided us with a coupon for 20% off for weekday buffets. I really appreciate the hospitality we received there, especially from Nabi. Although Sitar was quite far and not so accessible for us without a car, we might have to visit them again!Vegetarian options: Majority of the dishes were vegetarian, and vegan-friendly.Dietary restrictions: All meats served during the buffet are halal certified, for which their halal certification is up in the restaurant.

Visitiamo spesso questo locale, specialmente nel weekend, per colazioni e brunch. Il suo accompagnamento naturale sono i bignè freschissimi o, per i più attenti alla linea, il mitico banana bread della Lodo, regina indiscussa del locale.Menzione d’onore alla selezione musicale: dal grande pop in chiave bossa nova, alla musica d’atmosfera, ai classiconi della musica nostrana. We arrived in a hurry at 12:15 because of a guide and we only had like 40 minutes to eat. We told the waitress that we are in a hurry and we want breakfast , but she told us its finished at 12 but she will talk at the kitchen and she came back with a positive answer. After 10 short minutes we had a perfect omlet with ham and cheese and 2 cappuccinos. Perfect serving and very good food. Highly recommend the restaurant.
The only good thing about this place is the setting and the waiter is nice! However, the food was not fresh at all, we couldn’t finish our plates! The fish burger and the wok weren’t good at all

A very lovely outdoor seating restaurant with some very nice food. I gave 4 stars because for the price it wasn't as good as some other cheaper restaurants in the old town  where we had better flavours for €15 pp less, and despite having a long drinks menu, both of our 1st choices were either no longer stocked or out of stock.We had the duck breast and steak ragu. Both were lovely but I did struggle to finish mine. It was a generous portion compared to the duck but was too rich for me to finish. The duck was missing something I thought, it was just the bed of mascarpone polenta and 2 sttips of duck breast, no veg.The dessert was the highlight, an almond cake, named "traditional dubrovnik" which was fresh and light and cakes and lovely.All in all a very nice restaurant but steep prices compared to other options.
